page.title: 04FARMING AROUND SANDHEAD
page.content: by Alan Mason aged 12 Farming is more difficult than it looks. On our farm we only keep sheep, but they have to be looked after very carefully in the Spring when they are having their lambs; they have to be shorn in the summer; and we have to grow fodder to keep them alive through the winter. In our Block the main type of farming is Dairy Farming. Dairy farmers get up VERY early in the morning to milk their cows, some as early as 3-00am so that they can get three milkings in a day. Not many do this of course. The main breeds of cattle used for these milking herds are Ayrshires and Fresians; although there are herds of Jerseys and Holsteins in the district. Most farmers tend to stick to their own breed, claiming them to be best.
